programs.name: Private Coaching
programs.description: One-on-one sessions tailored to your child's specific needs and goals.

programs.name: Weekend Clinics
programs.description: Drop-in weekend sessions for extra practice and skills work.

content.heroSubheadline: Professional soccer training for kids ages 6-18 in Springfield, IL

about.mission: At Elite Soccer Academy, we believe every child deserves the chance to experience the joy of soccer. Our mission is to develop well-rounded athletes who excel on the field and in life through expert coaching, positive mentorship, and a love for the beautiful game.
about.coachBio: Coach Mike has over 10 years of experience coaching youth soccer at all levels. A former collegiate player and USSF-licensed coach, he founded Elite Soccer Academy with a simple goal: make high-quality soccer training accessible to every family in Springfield. His coaching philosophy centers on building confidence, developing technical skills, and fostering a genuine love for the sport.

values.title: Excellence
values.description: We push every athlete to reach their full potential through structured, progressive training.

values.title: Character
values.description: Sportsmanship, respect, and integrity are at the core of everything we do.

values.title: Community
values.description: We build a supportive environment where every family feels welcome and valued.

values.title: Fun
values.description: We believe kids play their best when they're having fun. Joy is the foundation of great soccer.

faq.question: What ages do you accept?
faq.answer: We offer programs for children ages 6 through 18. Our camps and clinics are grouped by age and skill level to ensure every player gets the right level of instruction.

faq.question: Do I need to bring my own equipment?
faq.answer: Players should bring shin guards, cleats, and a water bottle. We provide training balls, cones, and all other equipment needed for sessions.

faq.question: What is your refund policy?
faq.answer: We offer a full refund if you cancel at least 7 days before the program starts. After that, we offer a 50% refund or credit toward a future session.

faq.question: Are your coaches background-checked?
faq.answer: Absolutely. All of our coaches undergo comprehensive background checks and are certified in first aid and CPR.

faq.question: Can my child try a session before committing?
faq.answer: Yes! We offer a free trial session for any of our group programs. Just contact us to schedule one.

faq.question: What happens if it rains?
faq.answer: We monitor weather closely. If conditions are unsafe, we move to our indoor training space or reschedule the session. Parents are notified by text and email.

faq.question: How do I register my child?
faq.answer: You can register online through our website by visiting the Register page, or contact us directly by phone or email and we'll walk you through it.

faq.question: Do you offer sibling discounts?
faq.answer: Yes! We offer a 10% discount for the second child and 15% for each additional sibling enrolled in the same program.

faq.question: What skill levels do you work with?
faq.answer: All levels are welcome — from beginners who have never kicked a ball to advanced players preparing for competitive travel teams.

faq.question: Where are sessions held?
faq.answer: Most sessions are held at our main facility at 123 Field Drive, Springfield, IL. Some weekend clinics may be held at partner facilities — we'll always communicate the location in advance.
